fire-resistance.description: relative value obtained through comparison; fluid-specific

viscosity-temp.-prop..description: relative value, better viscosity index means better lubricant

seal-compatibility.description: relative value, higher the seal compatibility the better

lubricating-quality.description: relative value, higher lubricating quality the better

max-temp.-range.description: deg. C; maximum operable temperature range

flash-point.description: deg. C; minimum temp. at which enough vapour is formed for ignition, lower flash point means more flammability

auto-ignition-temp..description: deg. C; measures ability to withstand overheating and contact with hot surfaces

heat-of-combustion.description: higher heat of combustion indicates higher chance to spread; kJ/g H20(g)

flame-propagation-speed.description: cm/s; rate of expansion of flame front

spray-ignition-temp..description: deg. C; minimum oil temperature at 100 psig

spray-ignition-pressure.description: psig; minimum oil pressure at 20 deg. C

relative-cost.description: cost rel. to pet. hyd. fluid as 1
